src:
Galaxy Note 10 dan Galaxy A Jadi Berkah Buat Samsung
01 Nov 2019, 17:18 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Galaxy Note 10. Foto: Adi Fida Rahman/detikINET

Jakarta - Keuntungan operasional Samsung menurun 56% pada kuartal III 2019 seiring melambatnya permintaan untuk chip memory. Namun raksasa elektronik asal Korea Selatan itu terbantu dengan kuatnya penjualan smartphone Galaxy Note 10 serta seri Galaxy A.Dikutip detikINET dari CNN, Samsung melaporkan keuntungan USD 6,7 miliar, turun dari USD 15,1 miliar di tahun silam. Penjualan turun 5% dari tahun lalu, tapi naik 10% dari kuartal sebelumnya."Profit turun tajam dari setahun lalu tapi meningkat dari kuartal silam seiring penjualan smartphone yang kuat dan meningkatnya penggunaan layar OLED diiringi pelemahan pasar chip memory," sebut Samsung.Mereka menambahkan bahwa penjualan smartphone berkembang signifikan pada kuartal ini, dipicu pengapalan yang kuat dari seri Galaxy Note 10 dan model-model Galaxy A.Bisnis smartphone Samsung membukukan keuntungan USD 2,5 miliar, naik 32%. Namun mereka memperingatkan bahwa penjualan akan melemah sampai sisa tahun ini terkait kondisi ekonomi dan efek musiman.Samsung sampai saat ini masih kukuh di ranking pertama vendor smartphone terbesar. Mereka juga diuntungkan dengan kondisi vendor nomor dua, Huawei, yang tengah ditekan pemerintahan Amerika Serikat.Tak boleh memakai aplikasi Google memberi pukulan tersendiri bagi Huawei. Di Eropa yang jadi salah satu kekuatan Huawei, market share Samsung naik 40%.Simak Video "Transfer Data Jadi Mudah Pakai Samsung DeX di Galaxy Note 10 "[Gambas:Video 20detik](fyk/rns)
text:
Galaxy Note 10 and Galaxy A So Blessings For Samsung
01 Nov 2019, 17:18 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Galaxy Note 10. Photo: Adi Fida Rahman / detikINET

Jakarta - Samsung's operating profit decreased 56% in the third quarter of 2019 as slowing demand for memory chips. But the electronics giant from South Korea was helped by strong sales of the Galaxy Note 10 smartphone and the Galaxy A series. Quoted from CNN, Samsung reported a profit of USD 6.7 billion, down from USD 15.1 billion last year. Sales fell 5% from a year ago, but rose 10% from the previous quarter. "Profit fell sharply from a year ago but increased from the previous quarter as strong smartphone sales and increased use of OLED screens accompanied by a weakening in the memory chip market," said Samsung. that smartphone sales expanded significantly this quarter, driven by strong shipments of the Galaxy Note 10 series and Galaxy A. Samsung smartphone business posted a profit of USD 2.5 billion, up 32%. But they warned that sales would weaken for the rest of the year due to economic conditions and seasonal effects. Samsung is still firmly ranked first among the biggest smartphone vendors. They also benefit from the number two vendor condition, Huawei, which is being pressured by the United States government. It is not permissible to use Google's application to give a separate blow to Huawei. In Europe, which is one of Huawei's strengths, Samsung's market share is up 40%. Watch Video "Data Transfer Makes It Easy to Use Samsung DeX on Galaxy Note 10" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (fyk / rns)
